basics.name: Douglas Kent
basics.label: Fullstack Web3/Web Application Developer
basics.summary1: I am an experienced software engineer and project lead with 34+ years of repeated success leading teams and developing sophisticated Web, Web3 (blockchain) and desktop applications.
basics.summary2: As a coder, team lead or both, I have worn multiple hats in important roles in many types of situations from Microsoft to garage startups.
basics.summary3: Please see my complete resume at: https://www.douglaskent.com.
basics.summary4: I was born in the U.S. but am now based in Costa Rica. I am well accustomed to traveling and interacting with teams in such locations as in Europe, Canada, Israel, the U.S., India, Australia and others.
basics.summary5: I've worked with the likes of Microsoft, garage startups such as ConnectSoft, to Curve Labs where I led the development of a Refi dApp front end designed to emerge a regenerative, decentralized economic system for the sovereign island nation of Curaçao.
basics.summary6: I hope we can develop a mutually-beneficial and antifragile relationship together. Thanks for your interest and please read on!

work.summary: Invited back on contract. Developed an automated "Oracle" service maintaining states of Kolektivo regenerative finance (Refi) smart contracts on the Celo (EVM compatible) blockchain.
highlights: Worked on the Celo blockchain with the tokens kG, kCur and cUSD and a Balancer WeightedPool (kCur <> cUSD) ported to Celo by Symmetric

Leveraged smart contracts MentoReserve and the Balancer WeightedPool to maintain the value of the total supply of kCur in the MentoReserve contract equal to the value of the total supply of the kG token (by changing the total supply of kCur in the MentoReserve)
Leveraged the Balancer WeightedPool to help maintain kCur price stability within an acceptable range in its role of backing up kG
Leveraged OpenZeppelin Defender for managing private keys, encrypting secrets, sending transactions, hosting and invoking the service
Reported the prices of cUSD, kCur and kG price to smart contract Oracles

work.position: Development Team Lead and Lead Developer
work.summary: Led teams of 2-5 in the development of the frontends of multiple dApps running against the Ethereum blockchain focused on decentralized (Defi) and regenerative finance (Refi). Among others, led the development team for a Refi dApp designed to emerge a regenerative, decentralized economic system for the sovereign island nation of Curaçao. Here are couple of sites, but note that some of their functionality has been discontinued: Prime Deals and Prime Launch.
highlights: Lead and sole coder of the dApp frontends of Prime Pools (no longer active), Prime Locking For Reputation and the original PrimeDAO Home Page (no longer active)
Coordinated a team of two and did the majority of coding of the dApp frontend of Prime Launch
Coordinated a team of five and did much of the coding of the dApp frontend of Prime Deals
Coordinated a team of two and participated in the coding of the dApp frontend of Kolektivo (not currently active)
With the exception of the PrimeDAO Home Page, which uses React.js, the dApps were all implemented using the Aurelia framework
Leveraged many Ethereum smart contracts developed by CurveLabs, reviewing solidity for code quality, bugs and security, proposing accepted improvements and bug fixes
Leveraged Balancer Liquidity Pools, smart contracts that implement decentralized automated market makers
Leveraged GnosisSafe API, for governance purposes
Leveraged CoinGecko for token prices
Interviewed applicants for developer and project lead positions
As products, these applications are innovative and impressive. Read more about them at Kolektivo and The Prime Suite

work.summary: Performed multiple development roles in the design, creation and use of DAOstack DAOs, one of the first major DAO designs in the history of DAOs.  Used, reviewed and deployed Solidity smart contracts, wrote a Typescript library to support dApps in accessing the smart contracts, wrote a test dApp, significantly contributed to the dApp Alchemy used for working with the DAOs, and more...
highlights: One of the primary later developers of Alchemy, the DAOstack website enabling anyone to participate in DAOstack DAOs
One and a half years coding with React.js in Alchemy
Leveraged DAOstack Arc Solidity smart contracts, reviewing Solidity for code quality, bugs and security, proposing accepted improvements and bug fixes
Responsible for deploying DAOstack Arc smart contracts to Ethereum

Implemented and helped to design the dxDAO Vote Staking Interface, a website for initializing reputation in the dxDAO, a new decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) that governs the DutchX, a permissionless trading protocol for ERC20 tokens on the Ethereum blockchain. (The UI will disappear on 2019-06-28 when the dxDAO initialization period ends, but you can see walkthroughs here and here.)
Designed and implemented a well-reviewed architecture for the original version of DAOstack Arc.js
Implemented Vanille, open-source software that leverage DAOStack Arc to facilitate the creation of DAOstack DAOs

work.summary: As a member of the PSP business intelligence (BI) analytics group, single-handedly developed successful web applications for other departments within PSP
highlights: Many commented that these websites were the most performant and usable ever internally developed at PSP
One web application enabled users to search unstructured documents using a google-like interface and semantic search technologies
Another website reported data in charts, graphs and tables to assist PSP's executive portfolio rebalancing committee

Conducted research on knowledge base and graph and RDF database technologies and products, including AllegroGraph, Semaphore and Neo4j, to plot directions for expanding PSP's knowledge-based search capabilities

work.summary: Lead an offshore development team and participated in an Agile Scrum environment in the architecture and development of portions of a complex enterprise-scale, customer-facing web application
highlights: In daily scrums, coordinated and helped train a team of seven developers located in India.  Training was primarily on Agile, development processes, and in the standards of code development quality upheld at Revionics

Led a team three developers in India in the architecture and development of a web GUI for managing security rights in the Revionics web application.  Responsible for the entire architecture, quality of the result, coordination of the entire team, and timely delivery.  Did half the coding myself
Saved the security rights project, in jeopardy of missing its deadline, by dropping the size of the assisting team from 7 to 3 (sad but necessary)
Helped port a complex web GUI from ASP.NET to MVC.NET 3.0.  Designed the server-side architecture for the team.  Wrote most of the server-side code and assisted with client-side

Developed an unobtrusive framework for logging web application activity using dependency injection and API interception using Unity and a plugin architecture using the Managed Extensibility Framework (MEF)

Designed, developed and prototyped a reusable/extensible framework for writing SpecFlow integration tests using Unity, Moq and VSTest.  The prototype was written against Selenium to drive automated GUI tests

work.position: Senior Lead Web Developer, Manager Partner Integrations
work.summary: Performed a lead role in an Agile Scrum environment in coding a complex enterprise-scale, customer-facing web application and associated automated web service interface
highlights: Meeting an urgent deadline, virtually single-handedly implemented a system for handling mission-critical incoming and outgoing (SMS) messages to and from cell phones.   The architecture spanned a web site, three web services, two windows services, and two Sql Server databases

Was the Lead Developer on the ShiftWise Vendor Management System (VMS), a large and complex web application used by hospital administrators and medical staffing agencies to improve the process of hiring and placing temporary medical staff in hospitals

Was Manager and Lead Developer of ShiftWise Partner Integrations (PI), a set of web services and Windows applications enabling automated integrations between the ShiftWise VMS application and ShiftWise' customers' backoffice systems
Was the Senior Developer of ShiftWise TextConnect, enabling nurses to interact with the ShiftWise VMS using cell phone text messaging (SMS)

As Interim Development Team Manager and the most experienced .NET developer on the team, coordinated and set priorities for the team; helped raise the skills of the developers and improve the quality of output of the software engineering process
Worked smoothly with ShiftWise clients to plan and coordinate their side of the development of automated interfaces

work.summary: Wrote major components of Ford Motor Company's flagship Ford.com website
highlights: The Ford.com code was virtually flawless on first release
Wrote JSP and Java components, a Java/Swing applet that enabled administrators to edit the XML content using a browser, and a Flash binary SWF file preprocessor
Wrote thorough and professionally-styled User and Developer Guide documentation

work.summary: Enhanced and maintained the lease and loan sales features and Needs Analysis and Car Comparison features of carOrder.com's website
highlights: Took the initiative to write a 'Developer's Reference' web page for carOrder developers.  This document vastly reduced  the time required to bring new developers up to speed, as well as served as an ongoing reference for all developers on the team

Repaired broken Needs Analysis and Car Comparison features, fixed both the front end web GUI and the back-end scripts that generate the supporting data. Reduced to zero the flood of customer complaints about bad data and broken features
Designed and wrote an application to assist in browsing Jato automobile data
Ported DES-encryption-based software licensing code (see Imagen) from C++ to Java

work.summary: Provided sole development and support for an application critical to an international IBM workflow
highlights: Right off the bat solved a critical issue that had been vexing prior developers. IBM was very happy
Took the initiative to save this part of the IBM contract for Trilogy

work.summary: Wrote subsystem to facilitate localization of Encarta `97 into 5 languages
Managed team of 7 in code development and release to market of the Reader's Digest Complete Do-It-Yourself Guide multimedia CD-ROM title
Wrote the core GUI engine for Julia Child's Home Cooking With Master Chefs multimedia CD-ROM title
Developed software for Toolbook 3.0 and multimedia screensavers (Jurassic Park, et. al.)
On the Windows 3.1 team, developed software for File Manager, Packager, Paintbrush , Cardfile, and others
Managed all development efforts (see ConnectSoft, below)
Developed software for Clip-Art Window Shopper, an early electronic clip-art distribution application, and Presto 3D, a 3D CAD application
Developed object-oriented, resolution-independent 2D graphics code, including airbrushes, framebuffer manager, and graphics hardware emulator
Ported Visuals (see UNC below) to the SAS Graphical User Interface System
Wrote Visuals, an application that uses interactive 3D graphics animation to reveal meaning in multidimensional statistical data
Fixed bugs and developed new features for an internal web application used to coordinate trucks, drivers, routes and delivery locations across Québec
highlights: Fixed more bugs and added more features than the client planned-for

work.summary: Designed and implemented a personal website using encryption techniques enabling me to access all of my logins/passwords from anywhere without requiring SSL
highlights: Extensive use of hashing and encryption (both server and client-side), custom server-side authentication and other techniques to achieve data privacy with no SSL
Been through a couple iterations as technologies have changed.  Was Durandal+KnockoutJs+MsTest+ASP.NET, is now Aurelia+XUnit+ASP.NET Core

work.summary: Developed a website that gives Vivalia and its customers a highly efficient and enjoyable way to place and handle orders
highlights: Designed and created the entire website and database myself
Highly performant, pleasing and intuitive user interface
Used all best-available web application technologies
Well-structured, modular code amenable to future maintenance and enhancement

work.summary: Developed automated machine communication enabling two companies to vastly increase the efficiency of their relationship
highlights: Designed the whole thing, end-to-end
The only part I didn't write entirely myself was the AngularJs web application
Created a dynamic, data-driven schema for the exchanged content
Integrated lots of moving parts: an AngularJs web application, two external web services, .NET web server, Azure web job, and Sql Server database
Hosted on Azure

work.summary: Designed and implemented a web application to intelligently exchange resources relevant to the implications of watching too much television
highlights: Presented in French and English with instantaneous transition when switching between the two -- no postback
Takes users through a series of questions and customizes a set of resources according to their answers
Users can suggest and submit their own resources
Includes an extensive set of administration pages for creating the questions, answers and correlating them with resources

work.summary: Using ASP.NET, implemented main 'dashboard' web page and site-wide security code
highlights: Created web-based workflow involving inspections and tests of Texas turnpike construction
Implemented site-wide forms-based roles authorization and page customization, as well as user/groups management pages

work.summary: Enhanced a Java Swing application that enables users to display and edit data contained on Smart Cards
highlights: Enhanced a Java Swing application that enables users to display and edit data contained on Smart Cards
Designed and implemented a user-friendly panel system.  By integrating it snugly and efficiently into the existing code, provided enhanced functionality to both new code and existing code
Implemented application configuration files formatted as XML, accessed using Xerces

work.summary: Designed and developed NT Paymaster, a billing application for ISPs
Ported from DOS to Windows 95 MindMirror, an application that displays real-time electroencephalograph data in a GUI application

work.position: President, CEO, Director of Development, and Chief Programmer
work.summary: For the NEXTSTEP platform, designed and wrote TimeFlies, designed and implemented a 3D graphics API, and wrote the SwoopnPrint  "service" application. TimeFlies received a positive product review from NeXTWorld magazine
For EGA/VGA graphics hardware, developed code that reproduces PGA 3D and 2D graphics hardware commands
Assembled a local area network (LAN) and a system to digitize and manipulate video microscopic images for display in medical school classroom lab sessions
Conducted regulatory technical analyses, managed preparation of technical business proposals, managed a waste brokerage program

education.institution: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

references.name: Renç Korzay
references.reference: Doug is a brilliant front-end engineer who stands out for his exceptional professionalism, team-player attitude, and a strong sense of ownership. He goes out of his way to ensure that projects are delivered on time and to the highest possible standard. Doug is great at leading other developers and working across disciplines, he's an expert in prioritization and can dissect complex problems. His perfectionism and ability to set a great example for the team have been invaluable. I had the chance to work with Doug on multiple Web3 projects throughout the years and I would always look forward to an opportunity to work with him.
references.title: Web3 Product Manager

references.name: Ghalem Ben Nouna
references.reference: It's rare that you come across standout talent like Doug. I hired Doug as an application developer in my analytics team at PSP. He was able to complete the development of complex data products with complex custom visualizations on time. I was particularly impressed by Doug’s ability to precisely understand business requirements effortlessly due to his extensive experience as well as being an amazing team player.
references.title: Senior Director of Data Management and Business Intelligence at Ivanhoé Cambridge

references.name: Ross Barbieri
references.reference: I know Doug Kent both personally and professionally. I have had the great pleasure of working with him on several projects at multiple companies. These include industry changing applications like Shiftwise (healthcare staffing vendor management systems) and at large companies like GE . He is a highly reliable and methodical .NET web developer, and the best OO developer I've worked with. Doug works well solo and on teams and is an excellent communicator in both settings. On that point, he is an open and honest person and one who is not afraid to speak up (appropriately) when necessary. He is my go to .NET developer for these reasons, and also because he takes full ownership of his work; including peripheral dependencies, and will self manage through to completion.
references.title: Serial Entrepreneur, CTO and Software Development Manager

accomplishments: With Curve Labs, I coded, delivered and led, in some cases single-handedly, the front-end development of multiple complex Web3 dApps leveraging Ethereum smart contracts in the domains of decentralized finance (Defi) and regeneration (Refi).
With DAOstack, I helped design and develop some of the first-ever decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) Ethereum smart contracts, and helped develop a complex Web3 dApp to use them.

At Microsoft, I led a multi-disciplinary development team of 7 software engineers plus writers and graphic designers to produce a multimedia CD-ROM title for Windows. We delivered on time, meeting all quality goals.
At Microsoft, I incorporated the new technology of OLE 1.0 into Windows Write. OLE was a highly visible and strategic initiative of interest at the highest levels in Microsoft.

On a Microsoft project whose development lead and content developer each unexpectedly and simultaneously departed, I took the initiative to undertake some of each person's responsibilities, keeping the project on schedule and leading it to a successful market release.

In an enterprise website environment at ShiftWise, while facing an urgent deadline, I single-handedly implemented a complete system for handling mission-critical SMS messages. The architecture spanned a web site, three web services, two Windows services, and two Sql Server databases.

In an enterprise website environment at Revionics, I saved a project in jeopardy of missing its deadline. I took the counter-intuitive and risky step of dropping the assisting team from 7 to 3, but it enabled us to meet our deadline.

At ConnectSoft I led the development of an application that won a Windows 100 award from Windows Magazine: Clip-Art Window Shopper, one of the first ever applications for purchasing and downloading clip-art online.
For Ford Motor Company (via Trilogy) I designed, wrote, and delivered ahead of schedule a framework that served content to every page of the company's flagship website, Ford.com.

In my very first job as a software engineer, at the University of N. Carolina, I wrote a multi-dimensional data visualization application that was adopted as a product by the SAS Institute, a major statistical software company.
qualities: I have the maturity and experience to design, develop, coordinate, and lead a team from product conception to release.
I have the broad full-stack knowledge and self-starting mentality to single-handedly architect, design, implement, document, test and deploy an entire application.
I have worked with some of the best programmers and managers at some of the greatest software companies in the world.
I have a great record of success.
I am a great team player, leader and communicator, fully embracing team diversity and cohesiveness.
I am smart and educated: I attended one of the best graduate universities in the world.
I am creative and love solving challenging problems.
I enjoy mentoring anyone who seeks it.
I am reliable and honest: I speak truth to clients and colleagues.
I try to view situations from your point of view to anticipate your needs and assist you in building your antifragility.
